metadata.title: CVE-2015-8367 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
The phase_one_correct function in Libraw before 0.17.1 allows attackers tocause memory errors and possibly execute arbitrary code, related to memoryobject initialization.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-8367` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libraw-bin - 0.17.1-1
libraw15 - 0.17.1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libraw package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.17.1-1').
exactimage: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
rawtherapee: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
kodi: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
